intro: Oreodaphne indecora, commonly known as the hairy tallowwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the rainforests of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, spherical capsules containing several seeds. Oreodaphne indecora is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical rainforests.
